org.jscsi.target

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jscsi.target.Configuration

  • public class Configuration
extends Object
    Instances of Configuration provides access target-wide parameters, variables that are the same across all sessions and connections that do not change after initialization and which play a role during text parameter negotiation. Some of these parameters are provided or can be overridden by the content of an XML file - jscsi-target.xml.
    Author:
    Andreas Ergenzinger, University of Konstanz

      • targets

        protected final List<Target> targets

      • targetAddress

        protected String targetAddress
        The TargetAddress parameter (the jSCSI Target's IP address).

        This parameter is initialized automatically.

      • port

        protected int port
        The port used by the jSCSI Target for listening for new connections.

        The default port number is 3260. This value may be overridden by specifying a different value in the configuration file.

      • allowSloppyNegotiation

        protected boolean allowSloppyNegotiation
        This variable toggles the strictness with which the parameters IFMarkInt and OFMarkInt are processed, when provided by the initiator. Usually the offered values must have to following format: smallInteger~largeInteger, however the jSCSI Initiator sends only single integers as value part of the key-value pairs. Since the value of these two parameters always are Irrelevant, this bug can be ignored without any negative consequences by setting allowSloppyNegotiation to true in the configuration file. The default is false.

      • targetPortalGroupTag

        protected final int targetPortalGroupTag
        The TargetPortalGroupTag parameter.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • logicalUnitNumber

        protected final LogicalUnitNumber logicalUnitNumber
        The Logical Unit Number of the virtual Logical Unit.

      • outMaxRecvDataSegmentLength

        protected final int outMaxRecvDataSegmentLength
        The MaxRecvDataSegmentLength parameter for PDUs sent in the out direction (i.e. initiator to target).

        Since the value of this variable is equal to the specified default value, it does not have to be declared during login.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • create

        public static Configuration create(File schemaLocation,
                   File configFile)
                            throws SAXException,
                                   ParserConfigurationException,
                                   IOException
        Reads the given configuration file in memory and creates a DOM representation.
        Throws:
        SAXException - If this operation is supported but failed for some reason.
        ParserConfigurationException - If a DocumentBuilder cannot be created which satisfies the configuration requested.
        IOException - If any IO errors occur.
